column4: isn't there an easier way to unpack a tar.gz file than the whole extracting in archive manager crap?
preface statements directied to individuals with their name or some of us won't see it.
okay, I understand tar, why all the zxvf
read the fantastically documented manual. "man tar"
and the programme "file" will tell you what a file 'actually' is. not like windows where the characters after the dots mean something.
I'm still confused by the whole things after dots don't mean anything
try going into your home directory and doing the command 'file blah' where blah is some file.
now try doing it on a bunch of different files. linux doesn't care what the file is called. ie thing.tar.gz then rename to thing.wooble would not change the file.
a symbolic link is handy to point to a place. i.e. put a link to /mnt/thing/stuff/thing/blah in your home directory that stops you from having to type the whole path out.
man is your friend. more than google really. e.g. 'man ln'
remember that it's still a stupid computer.
I learned that, but some really basic commands arn't in man
I can't remember now, but I've typed a few commands in before and I guess I typed the wrong thing because I got no page
